definition: initial/arising first/same as 首先發起|首先发起
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive

sentences.english: He was the eighth Japanese-born pitcher to make his Major League debut as a starter.
sentences.chinese: 他是第八位日籍投手能在大聯盟裏先發的投手。

sentences.english: The survey said the average annual first-team wage at Barcelona was ￡4.94m.
sentences.chinese: 巴薩先發陣容球員平均年薪爲494萬英鎊。

sentences.english: All of Trenton 's starters drove in at least one run.
sentences.chinese: 特頓所有的先發打者們都至少打回了一分。

sentences.english: Williams, the starter at the point, is also a free agent.
sentences.chinese: 威廉姆斯，雄鹿的先發控衛，也是自由身。

sentences.english: Squatting under the pinasters in front of the temple gate he kills the dog.
sentences.chinese: 陳先發他蹲在廟門前的松樹下殺狗。

sentences.english: You probably know about first-mover advantages.
sentences.chinese: 你可能聽說過“先發優勢”。

sentences.english: Ten weeks later, those first four starts seem more like an omen.
sentences.chinese: 十週後，那前四場先發更像是個預兆。

sentences.english: Kershaw was the starting pitcher that day.
sentences.chinese: 克肖是當天的先發投手。

sentences.english: Their starting five is of high quality players, but they are aging quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他們的先發五虎實力出色，但存在老化的問題。

sentences.english: Wang began the season with three rough starts that convinced the Yankees he had to be hurt.
sentences.chinese: 小王季初三場糟糕的先發，讓洋基確信他一定有受傷。

sentences.english: Mr Dougan says that Credit Suisse will have a “first mover advantage”.
sentences.chinese: 杜根先生說，瑞士信貸銀行將有一個“先發優勢”。

sentences.english: Call a "Quality Start" as a catcher in any RTTS game.
sentences.chinese: 在RTTS模式中，作爲捕手叫出一場“優質先發”。

sentences.english: Mike Mussina, who skipped a start yesterday, threw a bullpen session Friday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天跳過先發的穆帥，星期五已經開始在牛棚練投。

sentences.english: Chien-Ming Wang will get one more start in the regular season, probably Wednesday against Baltimore.
sentences.chinese: 小民本季還有一次先發，可能會在星期三對上金鶯隊。

sentences.english: He finally returned at the end of last month and had only made two starts before his ankle trouble.
sentences.chinese: 他在上月底王者歸來，但僅僅先發兩場就又傷了。

definition: to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
